content.description: Climb to the crack/slab, then left to the base of the wall (black streaks).  Keep working up to the arete/ceiling, pulling through it at a small right facing corner.
content.location: Start at a rock pedestal below a thin crack.

climbs.name: Two Lefts Don't Make It Right

content.description: Up blocky rock (2 bolts), then left and up to a wall with a horizontal crack to a stance below the overhanging headwall.  Climb up the left side to anchors (crux).
content.location: Left side of first wall of climbs, at blocky rock and left of a right rising ramp.

content.description: Climb left of an open book to a rail and finger crack (left) to a right facing corner.  Exit corner left and climb to the top.
content.protection: 6 bolts, mixed (gear beta ADK Rock Second Edition page 62).   Fixed anchor.
content.location: Right side of the overhanging face, left of the large roof.

content.description: Climb to a corner, move left and climb up to the roof.  Move left and climb through a notch to top.
content.location: On far left side of cliff.

content.description: Climb overlap to the first bolt, then make a reachy move right.  Follow the bolt line up past ledges to another smaller overlap, through this to the top.
content.location: Right of the bulge in the center of the wall, on a large ledge below an overlap/small bulge.

content.description: From the right rising ramp move up and left to a ledge.  Up to a black streak vertical wall, then left above the overlap to Touran's top bolt.
content.location: 20' left of a short chimney, the right most route on the right most wall.

content.description: Up face/slab to ramp.  Climb left side of arete to the top.

Climb the blocky rock (2 bolts) staying right and heading straight up to a ledge.  [new bolt?]  Move right to an arete and follow this to the top [new bolt?], stepping right to the anchors above Touche.
content.protection:
8(?) bolts. *   Fixed anchor. 

 ADK Rock Second Edition page 61 topo indicates 6 bolts and page 63 description indicates runout between bolts 4 and 5, but I believe bolts have been added since.
content.location: Same as Two Lefts Don't Make It Right

content.description: At left end of a bulge (right of blocky rock) climb to the first bolt, then follow the obvious bolt line up the open book and through a small overhang (crux), up steepening terrain to the headwall.  Pull the headwall bulge to the anchor.
content.protection:
8(?) bolts. *   Fixed anchor. 

 It appears a bolt has been added near the bottom, and the route does not appear to have any signficant runout or ledge fall so dropped the PG13 protection grade indicated in ADK Rock Second Edition page 63.
content.location: Just right of Two Lefts Don't Make It Right

content.description: Climb to the first bolt (easiest from right), then up and right on ramp to ledge below steep face.  Climb face (jug crux) to top.
content.location: At bulging rock in the middle of the wall.

content.description: Go up steep, juggy rock to a ledge, then up face to a fixed anchor. 70'
content.location: Start: On the arÃªte just left of Timbuk-2 [route #10, volume 2, page 63 in Adirondack Rock].

content.description: Climb the right rising ramp to a small overhang, pull this and climb to a ledge.  From the ledge follow bolts on black streaked face to the top.
content.location: On a ledge 6 feet above the cliff base.

content.description: Climb the arete to a ledge, then follow the two bolts up and left to anchors.
content.location: At left side of a ledge 6 feet above the the cliff base

content.description:
From the block* climb to a ledge and climb the arete to a right rising ramp. Move left to a crack and follow this to the top.

 * block no longer there?
content.location: On ledge to the right of Shemtastic at a large block

content.description: Climb to the ledge, then left to a bulge.  Through the bulge, up to a small right facing corner.
content.location: Right of the 50' overhanging arete below a right rising rail on the face

content.description: Climb the short right facing corner, moving right to the arete.  Climb the left side of the arete for 15 feet, then climb the arete to a stance.  Pass the overhang on its right side to a stance under the roof, then a reachy move to the top.
content.location: Left of the 50' tall overhanging arete

content.description: Climb to the pillar, then climb the pillar and step right to clear the roof.  Climb the face (arete on left).
content.protection: 5 bolts, small cam(s) optional at start (see ADK Rock, Second Edition page 61).   Fixed anchor.

content.description: Across orange rock to an open book, to a right facing corner following this to the left side of the roof.  Traverse left on a horizontal crack.
Climb to and through the roof on its left.  Climb to the base of an offwidth in the corner and climb this to the top.  Use the anchors left (same for Messiah).

Partly shaded 70 foot cliff.  Secluded.  Shelving Rock is prone to loose/fragmented rock, so always wear a helmet.  This area was established only a few years ago so you may encounter loose rock.  We noted a few important holds were flexing on a couple different climbs. 

  Please upload some photos and draw routes on them if you have time.  I didn't think to snap photos on my visit here and was surprised to see it had not been added to MP.  The descriptions work well in finding things but nothing beats a photo with drawn in routes.
